projects.title: Kindergarten Canteen Attendance Management System
projects.description:
In this project, complete requirement analysis was made to provide a platform to record student attendance and canteen information in an efficient way in kindergarten schools in Trentino.

Generally kindergarten canteens have handwritten records of everything, including vital records about the student who come there daily. This implies that every morning teachers have to sign two separate lists. One for the class attendance and the other for canteen. In this case, both lists have the same content, however, they serve two different purposes. The class list is used for recording the attendance of the students. On the other hand, the canteen list is needed to know the number of meals to cook and the related quantity of each ingredient, for the students. This list is also used to check whether students with dietary restrictions or special dietary needs are present or not. The canteen list will also report whether each student needs to be granted only the lunch or also a mid-afternoon snack, depending on how many hours he or she will attend the school. In addition to that, every day the canteen staff have to compile a list with the number of meals served and, at the end of the month, send that list to the district office. Having all these data on paper results in frequent mistakes and consequential loss of time as they have to troubleshoot all the inconsistencies in both the attendance sheets. This problem exists in all the kindergarten schools in Trentino, since they all have their own canteen. 
Besides, parents are always concerned about the food and nutrition of their children. Almost every parent asks their children “What did you have for lunch and/or snack?” when they get back home from their school, having no way but this or an unpractical paper menu on school notice board to know what they ate. Thus in this project, the requirement analysis for all the stakeholders has been performed to develop an efficient software solution.

projects.title: ZOE
projects.description:
This project was awarded second place in StartUp Lab 2016 which was organized by CLab Trento, University of Trento, EIT Digital and Hub Innovation Trentino.

Hypertension is the single biggest risk factor for stroke and it also plays a significant role in heart attacks. But hypertension is a modifiable risk factor: it can be prevented and successfully treated, but only if you have it diagnosed and stick to your recommended management plan.

If you ignore your blood pressure because you think symptoms will alert you to the problem (symptoms such as nervousness, sweating, difficulty sleeping or facial flushing), the truth is that High Blood Pressure is largely a symptomless condition. Everybody needs to know their blood pressure numbers, and everyone needs to prevent high blood pressure from developing.

Our idea is a vital signs (e.g. blood pressure) wearable monitoring device to empower people on their way towards better health.

projects.title: Heart Monitoring System
projects.description: Heart Monitoring System is a console application which helps its users to track the status of their heart. This application obtains the current health status from the user and based on the information obtained, it automatically sets up goals, suggests activities to achieve that goal and recommends appropriate food for them. In addition to that, whenever the user logs into their account, they are always welcomed by a ‘Thought of the Day’ which is a quotation message.

projects.title: Huffman Coding
projects.description: In this project, Huffman Coding Algorithm has been implemented to achieve maximum compression. Measure time of this algorithm was taken by using Spark to achieve compression in various system configurations. Generic parallel programming model using MapReduce has also been implemented.

projects.title: Participatory Process on Media Communication Improvement of GLR
projects.description: Gira la Ruota (GLR) is a Bike Repair shop, located in Trento, Italy, that works for repairing bikes and giving workshops about the activity. On the core of the company, the workers are educators from a social cooperative called Kaleidoscopio and teenagers, where together, they work on learning and pedagogical growth of the young workers. In this project, details about the experience of individuals working in the company were captured and research for growing the organization and the company on online media was performed. All these studies were accomplished using participatory design approaches. After the research, the organization was recommended with the guidelines to improve their online media.
